001package com.github.tommyettinger.tantrum.digital.helpers;
002
003import org.apache.fory.memory.BoundsChecking;
004import org.apache.fory.memory.MemoryBuffer;
005import org.apache.fory.memory.Platform;
006
007public final class Support {
008    private Support() {
009    }
010
011    /**
012     * This method should be used to read data written by
013     * {@link MemoryBuffer#writePrimitiveArrayWithSize(Object, int, int)}.
014     */
015    public static boolean[] readBooleansAndSize(MemoryBuffer buffer) {
016        final int numBytes = buffer.readVarUint32();
017        int readerIdx = buffer.readerIndex();
018        final int size = buffer.size();
019        // use subtract to avoid overflow
020        if (BoundsChecking.BOUNDS_CHECKING_ENABLED && readerIdx > size - numBytes) {
021            throw new IndexOutOfBoundsException(
022                    String.format(
023                            "readerIdx(%d) + length(%d) exceeds size(%d): %s", readerIdx, numBytes, size, buffer));
024        }
025        final boolean[] booleans = new boolean[numBytes];
026        Platform.copyMemory(
027                buffer.getHeapMemory(), buffer.getUnsafeAddress() + readerIdx, booleans, Platform.BOOLEAN_ARRAY_OFFSET, numBytes);
028        buffer._increaseReaderIndexUnsafe(numBytes);
029        return booleans;
030    }
031
032    /**
033     * This method should be used to read data written by 
034     * {@link MemoryBuffer#writePrimitiveArrayWithSize(Object, int, int)}.
035     * It delegates to {@link MemoryBuffer#readBytesAndSize()}.
036     */
037    public static byte[] readBytesAndSize(MemoryBuffer buffer) {
038        return buffer.readBytesAndSize();
039    }
040
041    /**
042     * This method should be used to read data written by 
043     * {@link MemoryBuffer#writePrimitiveArrayWithSize(Object, int, int)}.
044     */
045    public static short[] readShortsAndSize(MemoryBuffer buffer) {
046        final int numBytes = buffer.readVarUint32();
047        int readerIdx = buffer.readerIndex();
048        final int size = buffer.size();
049        // use subtract to avoid overflow
050        if (BoundsChecking.BOUNDS_CHECKING_ENABLED && readerIdx > size - numBytes) {
051            throw new IndexOutOfBoundsException(
052                    String.format(
053                            "readerIdx(%d) + length(%d) exceeds size(%d): %s", readerIdx, numBytes, size, buffer));
054        }
055        final short[] shorts = new short[numBytes >>> 1];
056        Platform.copyMemory(
057                buffer.getHeapMemory(), buffer.getUnsafeAddress() + readerIdx, shorts, Platform.SHORT_ARRAY_OFFSET, numBytes);
058        buffer._increaseReaderIndexUnsafe(numBytes);
059        return shorts;
060    }
061
062    /**
063     * This method should be used to read data written by 
064     * {@link MemoryBuffer#writePrimitiveArrayWithSize(Object, int, int)}.
065     * It delegates to {@link MemoryBuffer#readCharsAndSize()}.
066     */
067    public static char[] readCharsAndSize(MemoryBuffer buffer) {
068        return buffer.readCharsAndSize();
069    }
070
071    /**
072     * This method should be used to read data written by 
073     * {@link MemoryBuffer#writePrimitiveArrayWithSize(Object, int, int)}.
074     */
075    public static int[] readIntsAndSize(MemoryBuffer buffer) {
076        final int numBytes = buffer.readVarUint32();
077        int readerIdx = buffer.readerIndex();
078        final int size = buffer.size();
079        // use subtract to avoid overflow
080        if (BoundsChecking.BOUNDS_CHECKING_ENABLED && readerIdx > size - numBytes) {
081            throw new IndexOutOfBoundsException(
082                    String.format(
083                            "readerIdx(%d) + length(%d) exceeds size(%d): %s", readerIdx, numBytes, size, buffer));
084        }
085        final int[] ints = new int[numBytes >>> 2];
086        Platform.copyMemory(
087                buffer.getHeapMemory(), buffer.getUnsafeAddress() + readerIdx, ints, Platform.INT_ARRAY_OFFSET, numBytes);
088        buffer._increaseReaderIndexUnsafe(numBytes);
089        return ints;
090    }
091
092    /**
093     * This method should be used to read data written by 
094     * {@link MemoryBuffer#writePrimitiveArrayWithSize(Object, int, int)}.
095     */
096    public static float[] readFloatsAndSize(MemoryBuffer buffer) {
097        final int numBytes = buffer.readVarUint32();
098        int readerIdx = buffer.readerIndex();
099        final int size = buffer.size();
100        // use subtract to avoid overflow
101        if (BoundsChecking.BOUNDS_CHECKING_ENABLED && readerIdx > size - numBytes) {
102            throw new IndexOutOfBoundsException(
103                    String.format(
104                            "readerIdx(%d) + length(%d) exceeds size(%d): %s", readerIdx, numBytes, size, buffer));
105        }
106        final float[] floats = new float[numBytes >>> 2];
107        Platform.copyMemory(
108                buffer.getHeapMemory(), buffer.getUnsafeAddress() + readerIdx, floats, Platform.FLOAT_ARRAY_OFFSET, numBytes);
109        buffer._increaseReaderIndexUnsafe(numBytes);
110        return floats;
111    }
112
113    /**
114     * This method should be used to read data written by 
115     * {@link MemoryBuffer#writePrimitiveArrayWithSize(Object, int, int)}.
116     */
117    public static long[] readLongsAndSize(MemoryBuffer buffer) {
118        final int numBytes = buffer.readVarUint32();
119        int readerIdx = buffer.readerIndex();
120        final int size = buffer.size();
121        // use subtract to avoid overflow
122        if (BoundsChecking.BOUNDS_CHECKING_ENABLED && readerIdx > size - numBytes) {
123            throw new IndexOutOfBoundsException(
124                    String.format(
125                            "readerIdx(%d) + length(%d) exceeds size(%d): %s", readerIdx, numBytes, size, buffer));
126        }
127        final long[] longs = new long[numBytes >>> 3];
128        Platform.copyMemory(
129                buffer.getHeapMemory(), buffer.getUnsafeAddress() + readerIdx, longs, Platform.LONG_ARRAY_OFFSET, numBytes);
130        buffer._increaseReaderIndexUnsafe(numBytes);
131        return longs;
132    }
133
134    /**
135     * This method should be used to read data written by 
136     * {@link MemoryBuffer#writePrimitiveArrayWithSize(Object, int, int)}.
137     */
138    public static double[] readDoublesAndSize(MemoryBuffer buffer) {
139        final int numBytes = buffer.readVarUint32();
140        int readerIdx = buffer.readerIndex();
141        final int size = buffer.size();
142        // use subtract to avoid overflow
143        if (BoundsChecking.BOUNDS_CHECKING_ENABLED && readerIdx > size - numBytes) {
144            throw new IndexOutOfBoundsException(
145                    String.format(
146                            "readerIdx(%d) + length(%d) exceeds size(%d): %s", readerIdx, numBytes, size, buffer));
147        }
148        final double[] doubles = new double[numBytes >>> 3];
149        Platform.copyMemory(
150                buffer.getHeapMemory(), buffer.getUnsafeAddress() + readerIdx, doubles, Platform.DOUBLE_ARRAY_OFFSET, numBytes);
151        buffer._increaseReaderIndexUnsafe(numBytes);
152        return doubles;
153    }
154}
